article.headline: Ohio 85, Buffalo 72
article.story: ATHENS, Ohio (AP) -- Mychal Green sparked an early Ohio run, scored 21 points and led the Bobcats to an 85-72 win Wednesday night over Buffalo. Green hit 8-of-11 from the field, including 5-of-7 from beyond the 3-point line. He added seven rebounds and two assists for Ohio (16-8, 9-6 Mid-American). The Bobcats had an early 10-2 run and extended the lead to as big as 18 points in the first half. Buffalo (16-11, 6-9) closed the deficit to 11 during the first two minutes of the second half before Ohio scored 13 straight points, including four each by Leon Williams and Sonny Troutman. That gave the Bobcats the lead for good. Buffalo never drew closer than 12 during the second half. Ohio guard Tony Chatman finished with 12 points and five assists, Troutman added 11 points and Williams scored 10. Buffalo guard Calvin Cage scored 20 points. Mario Jordan added 15 points and a game-high nine rebounds. The Bulls have lost eight straight games at Ohio since they rejoined the MAC in 1998.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
